text: everyone talks about budget it's the
biggest thing holding people back from
traveling newsflash
traveling doesn't have to be expensive
if you're willing to make some
sacrifices the freight how much does it
cost to travel is somewhat misleading
because travel is a broad term it can
mean wandering around Havana Cuba for
zero dollars or going on a safari in
Botswana for $4,000
it can mean eating a bowl of foie on the
streets of Hanoi for fifty cents or
dining at a steak house in Buenos Aires
for a hundred and fifty bucks
some countries are very expensive like
Norway Switzerland and Japan whereas
others like Bangladesh Bolivia and the
Philippines are very cheap but as a
general rule of thumb if you group all
countries and cities together I am
confident that you can travel
comfortably on $50 a day excluding
flights that means being a little more
frugal in expensive countries and being
more adventurous in cheaper one $50 is
an average for unglamorous travel and it
assumes you're a solo traveler if you
split hotel rooms and taxis with a
friend or two you're probably looking at
half that cost also that $50 a day
assumes you eliminate extra costs like
shopping activities gear and fancy meals
so on 50 bucks a day a 30 day trip will
cost you only $1,500 let's break it down
further $25 per day on accommodation $15
a day on food $10 a day on miscellaneous
this can be visa fees uber rides
souvenirs etc if you do like to splurge
on extra activities nicer hotels and
partying then you're looking at more
like $100 per day to travel comfortably
and on the contrary if you use
couchsurfing and cook your own food then
you could probably get by at $20 a day
it's all relative based on your budgets
and needs but I can tell you that's 50
US dollars a day will take you around
the world so if you start spending your
money wisely you can afford it I'm drew
pinsky and if you like my travel videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
